references.paper_title: Communication-efficient learning of deep networks from decentralized data
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the field of Federated Learning, introducing the communication-efficient learning techniques that are fundamental to many subsequent approaches.
This paper provides a comprehensive overview of Federated Learning, addressing critical aspects such as privacy and incentive mechanisms that are essential for practical implementations.

references.paper_title: Think locally, act globally: Federated learning with local and global representations
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of combining local and global representations within a federated learning framework, addressing the heterogeneity of data distributions across clients.
This paper proposes the Federated Mutual Learning approach, focusing on knowledge transfer between client and server models within the federated learning paradigm.
This paper introduces the Matryoshka Representation Learning framework, a multi-granular representation learning method that directly inspired the design of FedMRL.
